refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The client object handles the connection with a client for as long as a TCP connection is open.
A GstRTSPClient is created by GstRTSPServer when a new connection is accepted and it inherits the GstRTSPMountPoints, GstRTSPSessionPool, GstRTSPAuth and GstRTSPThreadPool from the server.

The client connection should be configured with the GstRTSPConnection using gst_rtsp_client_set_connection() before it can be attached to a GMainContext using gst_rtsp_client_attach(). From then on the client will handle requests on the connection.
Use gst_rtsp_client_session_filter() to iterate or modify all the GstRTSPSession objects managed by the client object.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a new GstRTSPClient.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_client_close ()
refsect2.para: Close the connection of client and remove all media it was managing.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_client_get_session_pool ()
refsect2.para: Get the GstRTSPSessionPool object that client uses to manage its sessions.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GstRTSPSessionPool, unref after usage.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_client_set_session_pool ()
refsect2.para: Set pool as the sessionpool for client which it will use to find or allocate sessions. the sessionpool is usually inherited from the server that created the client but can be overridden later.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_client_get_mount_points ()
refsect2.para: Get the GstRTSPMountPoints object that client uses to manage its sessions.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GstRTSPMountPoints, unref after usage.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_client_set_mount_points ()
refsect2.para: Set mounts as the mount points for client which it will use to map urls to media streams. These mount points are usually inherited from the server that created the client but can be overriden later.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_client_get_auth ()
refsect2.para: Get the GstRTSPAuth used as the authentication manager of client .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GstRTSPAuth of client . g_object_unref() after usage.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_client_set_auth ()
refsect2.para: configure auth to be used as the authentication manager of client .

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_client_get_thread_pool ()
refsect2.para: Get the GstRTSPThreadPool used as the thread pool of client .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GstRTSPThreadPool of client . g_object_unref() after usage.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_client_set_thread_pool ()
refsect2.para: configure pool to be used as the thread pool of client .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GstRTSPConnection of client . The connection object returned remains valid until the client is freed.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_client_set_connection ()
refsect2.para: Set the GstRTSPConnection of client . This function takes ownership of conn .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE on success.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_client_attach ()
refsect2.para: Attaches client to context . When the mainloop for context is run, the client will be dispatched. When context is NULL, the default context will be used).
This function should be called when the client properties and urls are fully configured and the client is ready to start.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the ID (greater than 0) for the source within the GMainContext.

refsect2.title: GstRTSPClientSendFunc ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean (*GstRTSPClientSendFunc) (GstRTSPClient *client, GstRTSPMessage *message, gboolean close, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: This callback is called when client wants to send message . When close is TRUE, the connection should be closed when the message has been sent.

entry.para: user data when registering the callback

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE on success.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_client_set_send_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gst_rtsp_client_set_send_func (GstRTSPClient *client, GstRTSPClientSendFunc func, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify notify);
refsect2.para: Set func as the callback that will be called when a new message needs to be sent to the client. user_data is passed to func and notify is called when user_data is no longer in use.
By default, the client will send the messages on the GstRTSPConnection that was configured with gst_rtsp_client_attach() was called.

entry.para: called when user_data is no longer in use.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GstRTSPResult.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_client_send_message ()
refsect2.para: Send a message message to the remote end. message must be a GST_RTSP_MESSAGE_REQUEST or a GST_RTSP_MESSAGE_RESPONSE.

entry.para: a GstRTSPSession to send the message to or NULL.

refsect2.title: GstRTSPClientSessionFilterFunc ()
refsect2.para: This function will be called by the gst_rtsp_client_session_filter(). An implementation should return a value of GstRTSPFilterResult.
When this function returns GST_RTSP_FILTER_REMOVE, sess will be removed from client .
A return value of GST_RTSP_FILTER_KEEP will leave sess untouched in client .
A value of GST_RTSP_FILTER_REF will add sess to the result GList of gst_rtsp_client_session_filter().

entry.para: user data that has been given to gst_rtsp_client_session_filter()

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GstRTSPFilterResult.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_client_session_filter ()
refsect2.programlisting: GList * gst_rtsp_client_session_filter (GstRTSPClient *client, GstRTSPClientSessionFilterFunc func, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para:
Call func for each session managed by client . The result value of func
determines what happens to the session. func will be called with client
locked so no further actions on client can be performed from func .
If func returns GST_RTSP_FILTER_REMOVE, the session will be removed from client .
If func returns GST_RTSP_FILTER_KEEP, the session will remain in client .
If func returns GST_RTSP_FILTER_REF, the session will remain in client but will also be added with an additional ref to the result GList of this function..
When func is NULL, GST_RTSP_FILTER_REF will be assumed for each session.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GList with all sessions for which func returned GST_RTSP_FILTER_REF. After usage, each element in the GList should be unreffed before the list is freed.

refsect2.title: struct GstRTSPClient
refsect2.para: The client object represents the connection and its state with a client.

refsect2.title: struct GstRTSPClientClass

entry.para: called when the SDP needs to be created for media.
called when the stream in media needs to be configured. The default implementation will configure the blocksize on the payloader when spcified in the request headers.
called when the client transport needs to be configured.
set parameters. This function should also initialize the RTSP response(ctx->response) via a call to gst_rtsp_message_init_response()
get parameters. This function should also initialize the RTSP response(ctx->response) via a call to gst_rtsp_message_init_response()
called when a response to the GET request is about to be sent for a tunneled connection. The response can be modified. Since 1.4

refsect2.title: The drop-backlog property
refsect2.para: Drop data when the backlog queue is full.

refsect2.title: The mount-points property
refsect2.para: The mount points to use for client session.

refsect2.title: The session-pool property
refsect2.para: The session pool to use for client session.

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect3.para: a newly allocated string with comma-separated list of unsupported options. An empty string must be returned if all options are supported.
